# 1.4 About Each School: Grades, Programs & Profiles ## Learning Objectives By the end of this lesson, you will be able to: - Identify the different academic levels and programmes offered at Excel High School - Describe the flagship programmes that make Excel High School unique - Recognise how different student profiles can succeed through various academic pathways - Navigate key sections of the Canvas learning management system to access your courses and support Starting your high school journey online might feel a bit different from what you expected, but don't worry—you're in good hands. Whether you're brand new to high school or transferring from another school, this orientation will help you understand the opportunities ahead of you.
Excel High School's flexible, self-paced approach means you can learn according to your own schedule while still getting personalised support from qualified teachers and success coaches. Let's dive into what makes Excel special and how you can make the most of your time with us. ## Excel High School Academic Programmes Excel High School offers several academic tracks to match your goals and learning needs: **Standard Diploma Track** This college-preparatory curriculum covers all core subjects (English, Maths, Science, and Social Studies) along with electives that meet traditional high school graduation requirements. The standard track provides a solid foundation for college or career success. **Honours Diploma Track** For those seeking more academic challenge, the Honours Diploma Track offers advanced coursework that explores subjects in greater depth. Completing this track shows colleges that you've pursued a rigorous high school curriculum. **Advanced Placement (AP) Courses** Excel offers AP courses that allow you to tackle college-level material while still in high school. These challenging courses can help you earn college credit through AP exams and strengthen your college applications. **CA A-G Curriculum** For students planning to apply to University of California or California State University schools, Excel offers courses that satisfy the A-G requirements for admission. This specialised curriculum ensures you meet the specific prerequisites for these university systems. **Adult High School Programme** For students 18 and older who are returning to complete their high school education, Excel offers a flexible adult programme that works around job and family responsibilities while providing the same quality education. ## Flagship Programmes Excel High School stands out from other online schools through several signature programmes: **Dual Enrolment Programme** One of our most popular options allows you to earn both high school and college credits simultaneously. Through partnerships with accredited colleges, you can get a head start on your college education while still completing your high school diploma. **Career and Technical Education (CTE) Pathways** If you're interested in developing job-ready skills, our CTE pathways offer specialised courses in fields like business, healthcare, information technology, and more. These courses help you explore potential careers and develop practical skills. **Personalised Learning Plans** Every Excel student works with a Success Coach to create an individualised learning plan based on your goals, interests, and academic needs. This tailored approach ensures you're taking the right courses at the right pace for your unique situation. **College and Career Counselling** Our dedicated counsellors help you navigate the college application process, explore scholarship opportunities, and plan for your future beyond high school. Tools like MyPlan assist you in discovering potential career paths that match your interests and strengths. ## Student Profiles and Pathways Excel High School serves students from diverse backgrounds with varying goals and circumstances. Here are some common student profiles: **College-Bound Students** Many Excel students follow a traditional college-prep track, taking honours or AP classes to prepare for university admission. These students often participate in dual enrolment to earn early college credits and strengthen their applications. **Career-Focused Students** Some students have specific career goals and use Excel's flexible curriculum to focus on relevant skills and knowledge. These students might combine core academic courses with CTE electives or pursue industry certifications alongside their diploma. **Student Athletes and Performers** Excel's flexible, self-paced format is ideal for serious athletes, musicians, actors, and other performers who need to balance training or performance schedules with their education. You can complete coursework around competitions, rehearsals, or travel. **Students Seeking Flexibility** Whether due to health concerns, family responsibilities, or personal preference, many students choose Excel because they need a flexible learning environment. Our self-paced approach allows you to work when and where it's best for you. **International Students** Excel welcomes students from around the world who want to earn an accredited American high school diploma. Our online format makes quality education accessible regardless of geographic location.
No matter which profile sounds most like you, Excel High School has the resources and support to help you succeed on your chosen path. ## Navigating the Learnstage Learning System ### NOTE: THIS SECCTION IS "FAKE" Your educational journey at Excel takes place within our Canvas learning management system (Canvas). Here's how to navigate the key sections: **Dashboard** When you log in, your dashboard shows all your current courses, upcoming assignments, and important announcements. This is your home base for tracking progress and staying organised. **Courses** Click on any course tile to access your lessons, assignments, digital textbooks, and video content. Each course is organised into sections that guide you through the material in a logical sequence. **Grades** The Grades section shows your current standing in all courses. You can view individual assignment scores, teacher feedback, and your overall progress. This helps you stay on track and identify areas where you might need additional support. **Calendar** The Calendar feature displays all your upcoming assignments and due dates in one place. While Excel offers flexible pacing, setting personal deadlines helps you maintain steady progress toward graduation. **Inbox** Use the Inbox to communicate directly with your teachers and Success Coach. Don't hesitate to reach out whenever you have questions or need clarification on course material. **Help Desk** If you encounter technical issues or need academic support, the Help Desk connects you with the right resources. You can submit a request and receive assistance from our dedicated support team.
Take some time to explore these features in Canvas. Becoming familiar with the system will make your online learning experience much smoother and more enjoyable. ## Over to You: Identifying Your Pathway Now that you've learnt about Excel High School's academic programmes, flagship offerings, and student pathways, take a moment to reflect on your own goals and interests.
Consider these questions: - Which academic track (Standard, Honours, AP) aligns with your goals and abilities? - Are you interested in dual enrolment or CTE courses? - Which student profile most closely matches your situation? - What support services will be most helpful for your success? In the discussion forum, share your thoughts about which pathway seems like the best fit for you and why. Reading about your classmates' goals can help you discover options you might not have considered.
Remember, your pathway isn't set in stone! Many Excel students adjust their academic plans as they discover new interests or set new goals. Your Success Coach is always available to help you navigate changes and make sure you're on the right track. ---keytakeaways--- ## Key Takeaways - Excel High School offers multiple academic tracks (Standard, Honours, AP) and specialized programs like Dual Enrollment and CTE pathways that can be tailored to your specific educational goals and life circumstances. - The school's flexible, self-paced approach accommodates diverse student profiles including college-bound students, career-focused learners, athletes, performers, and international students. - Canvas learning management system provides essential tools for success including your course dashboard, grades section, calendar, and communication channels with teachers and support staff. ---keytakeawaysEND---

# Preparatory Context for Content Enhancement

## Content Summary
The current content provides an overview of the academic programs, flagship offerings, and student profiles at Excel High School, an accredited asynchronous online learning environment. It outlines the school's standard, honors, and advanced placement (AP) diploma tracks, as well as specialized programs like dual enrollment and career and technical education (CTE) pathways. The content also introduces the school's learning management system, Canvas, and encourages students to reflect on which academic pathway best suits their goals and interests.

## Enhancement Requirements
Based on the enhancement prompt, the key objectives are to:
1. Improve the flow and remove potential barriers to learning by addressing any unanswered questions a first-time learner might have.
2. Reduce repetition of certain signposting phrases (e.g., "Building on the information architecture principles from your HNC studies") by rephrasing or removing them where appropriate.
3. Ensure the content is engaging and easy to read, avoiding a "bunch of facts right next to each other."

## Target Learner Considerations
The target learners are middle and high school students (ages 11-18) enrolled in Excel High School's asynchronous online program. Key points to consider:

- Reading level should be at a 5th-6th grade level for younger students, with progressive complexity for high schoolers.
- Content must be engaging and broken into manageable chunks, using explicit task directions, active verbs, and clear objectives.
- Favor visual and interactive elements like diagrams, examples, videos, and interactive tools to support diverse learning styles.
- Ensure cultural sensitivity and global awareness in examples and references.
- Design activities that can be completed with minimal materials and adapted for small or shared spaces.

## Learning Medium Considerations
As an asynchronous online program, the content must be optimized for self-paced, independent learning without daily external supervision. Considerations include:

- Providing clear navigation and progress tracking tools within the Canvas LMS.
- Incorporating strategies to help students stay motivated and on track without regular in-person check-ins.
- Ensuring accessibility and flexibility for students with varying levels of digital literacy and device access.

## Key Considerations
- Preserve the core purpose of introducing Excel High School's academic programs, flagship offerings, and student pathways.
- Address any potential gaps or questions a first-time learner might have to improve the flow and remove barriers to understanding.
- Reduce repetition of certain signposting phrases while still maintaining clear structure and guidance.
- Enhance the content's readability, engagement, and visual appeal to align with the target learner profile and online learning environment.

## Suggested Approach
1. Review the content through the lens of a first-time learner and identify any areas where additional explanation or clarification may be needed.
2. Strategically rephrase or remove repetitive signposting phrases to improve the flow, while preserving the core information.
3. Incorporate more visual elements, interactive components, and engaging language to align with the target learner's needs and the asynchronous online format.
4. Ensure the content maintains educational integrity, addresses the enhancement requirements, and adapts appropriately for the target learner profile and learning medium.

Remember, this preparatory context is intended to guide the subsequent content enhancement process. Focus on providing clear, actionable direction rather than specific edits.
